content.description: Figure 1. Percent saturation of human hemoglobins as a function of the partial pressure of oxygen
content.question: The graph in Figure 1 shows the percent saturation of fetal hemoglobin and maternal hemoglobin in humans as a function of the partial pressure of oxygen. Based on the data, which of the following values is closest to the predicted difference in the percent saturation of fetal hemoglobin and maternal hemoglobin at <math alttext="40 millimeters of H g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>40</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>mm</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>Hg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>?

skill.text: 4.B: Describe data from a table or graph, including: i. identifying specific data points ii. describing trends and patterns in the data iii. describing relationships between variables
